results.title: Tears of the black tiger = Fah talai jone
results.creator_credit: Aichi Arts Centre, Film Bangkok, Five Star Productions, Nonzee Nimibutr and Wisit Sasanatieng
results.brief_description: A story of ill-fated love between a peasant boy and a wealthy city girl; a film about the notorious “Black Tiger”, a Thai rural gang member with a touch of the Robin Hoods about him; and the story of how Black Tiger has to choose between love and the call of the outlaw past. So, obviously, the plot is ridiculous - but in this camp Western pastiche that doesn’t matter at all. A gloriously delirious subverting of the western genre, “Tears of the Black Tiger” features stunning colour cinematography which announces the film’s intention to be pure artifice and celebration of cinema as fantasy. The pleasures of the film are all to be found in the art direction, the music and the photography. It is also a homage to the camp excesses of “Duel in the sun” while also cheekily undermining the stoic Puritan heroes of the traditional western by lovingly detailing the homoeroticism that underlay so much of the masculine tension in the films of Ford, Hawks and the great Hollywood western directors. With Supakorn Kitsuwon, Arawat Ruangvuth, Sombati Medhanee and Apiroj Jaisinga.

results.title: Tea with Mussolini
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, Medusa Film, Cattleya, Cineritmo, G2, Riccardo Tozzi, Giovanella Zannoni, Clive Parsons and Franco Zeffirelli
results.brief_description: Loosely based on his childhood, Zeffirelli weaves this enchanting tale with a gentle, loving hand. It is the story of a diverse group of cultured ladies, living in Florence in 1934, who meet for tea each afternoon. The group includes Lady Random (Maggie Smith), widow of the British ambassador to Italy, Arabella (Judy Dench) an artist and singer, Georgie (Lily Tomlin), an exuberant American archaeologist, and the brash and uninhibited Elsa (Cher). One of the ladies, Mary (Joan Plowright), becomes a surrogate mother to a young boy, Luca, and he is soon virtually adopted and brought up by the group. As Luca grows to become a man, the shifting political climate begins to have a devastating impact on the rarified world in which the ladies exist, and they must come to terms not only with their own mortality but also the inescapable passage of time.

results.title: Targets
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Saticoy and Peter Bogdanovich
results.brief_description: The first feature of Peter Bogdanovich combines two seemingly unrelated plots. Plot one follows the depressed retiring horror film actor (Boris Karloff) and his despairing of the real horror of 60’s America. Meanwhile a lone sniper picks off strangers after coldly killing his parents and a delivery boy. The disquieting plots meet after tenion builds at a drive-in cinema. A tense and disturbing film. Cast also include Tim O’Kelly, Nancy Hsueh and James Brown.

results.title: Tapeheads
results.creator_credit: De Laurentiis Entertainment Group, Front Films, National Broadcasting Company, Pacific Arts, Peter McCarthy and Bill Fishman
results.brief_description: A satire on the music business, “Tapeheads” is about two childhood friends who, after losing their jobs as security guards decide to scam their way into the music video industry. Ivan (John Cusack) is the exuberant friend who is accustomed to getting the more reserved Josh (Tim Robbins) into trouble. Forming Video Aces, Ivan encourages Josh to develop his creativity whilst the business-like Ivan helms the operation. Initially the pair work on a hilarious rapping commercial for a chicken and waffle outlet and a dying man’s video-will. Whilst doing the thankless rounds of the production companies, Ivan meets music impresario Mo Fuzz, and after hiring them (on spec) they embark upon their first successful rock music video. From there the irrepressible duo encounter all manner of swindles and mishaps on a twisted route to success. This film tapped into the cultural moment that was the origins of the MTV generation with a fast paced script and rapid editing, but perhaps the filmmakers were ahead of their time because despite its infectious and irreverent humour “Tapeheads” was a box-office failure. Cameos includes Weird Al Yankovich, Ted Nugent, Jello Biafra, Junior Walker and Sam Moore.

results.title: Tank girl
results.creator_credit: United Artists Corporation, Trilogy Entertainment Group, Richard Lewis, Pen Densham, John Watson and Rachel Talalay
results.brief_description: The year is 2033 and water is a precious commodity. In the desolate wind swept plains, animals are banned, bathing is unheard of, and the Water & Power Company, headed by the villainous Kesslee (Malcolm McDowell), have ultimate control over the precious H20. One rebel girl stands in their way, Rebecca (Lori Petty), a chick with attitude and an outrageous hairstyle. She is captured by Water & Power when they kill her boyfriend, kidnap her young friend, and try to blackmail her into joining their team. As a prisoner Rebecca discovers a new passion- tanks, and makes a friend with mechanic and pilot, Jet Girl (Naomi Watts), who helps her escape. Once free the girls join forces with The Rippers, an army of half men and half kangaroos, genetically modified to be the ultimate fighting machines. Together they take Water & Power head on, lead by Jet Girl in the sky, and tank girl on the ground with her beloved tank in a flurry of live action and comic strip visuals. Cast also includes Ice-T, Don Harvey and Jeff Kober.

results.title: Talk to her = Hable con ella
results.creator_credit: El Deseo S. A., Agustin Almodovar and Pedro Almodovar
results.brief_description: Pedro Almodovar’s 14th feature, a tragic drama, is a paean to male friendship, longing and desire. Benigno is a male nurse dedicated to caring for a beautiful young ballerina, Alicia, comatose in the hospital where he works. A series of flashbacks reveal that Benigno’s obsession had earlier incarnations as he watched Alicia study dance from his gloomy flat. Simultaneously, a famous bullfighter, Lydia, is recovering from a broken affair when a new man, Marco, enters her life. Marco and Benigno’s paths become entangled and the two men seek ways to aid the other through several difficult moral dilemmas. Like the acclaimed “All about my mother” (1999), “Talk to her” is a film about relationships, the human desire to connect to others and the bonds formed through tragedy and grief. It is also a film that revels in ritual - dance, dressing, and undressing, nursing, bullfighting - many elements of the narrative are drawn from a sense of rite and ceremony in everyday life. A lyrical and compassionate film, “Talk to her” has traces of Almodovar’s surrealist past, with a splendid six-minute silent film, an interlude that celebrates man’s devotion to woman. Cast includes Javier Camara, Dario Grandinetti, Leonor Watling, Rosario Flores and Geraldine Chaplin.

results.title: Talk radio
results.creator_credit: Cineplex Odeon, Edward Pressman, A. Kitman Ho and Oliver Stone
results.brief_description: Based on the book “Talked to death: the life and murder of Alan Berg” by Stephen Singular, this film presents an often unseen side of talk radio of paranoia and passion. Eric Bogosian (who also wrote the play based on Singular’s book) stars as a contentious talk show host. He pushes the boundaries of political correctness and inspires emotions of love or hate from his listeners. His provocative broadcasts push one caller too far, leading to dire consequences. Also starring Alec Baldwin, Ellen Greene and John Pankow.

results.title: Take the money and run
results.creator_credit: Palomar Pictures International, Charles H. Joffe and Woody Allen
results.brief_description: Woody Allen stars, directs and co-authors this satire of all the prison dramas, chain gang eposes and true crime movies. It is basically a running gag about hero Virgil Starkwell, a master criminal who always bungles the crime (even one as simple as breaking into a gumball machine!), and ends up with more time in gaol than in his pursuit of crime. Full of Allen’s wry, dry wit this is one to delight the buffs and break the funny bone.

results.title: Take me out to the ball game
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Arthur Freed and Busby Berkeley
results.brief_description: To keep themselves occupied during the off season, Wolves baseball players O’Brien and Ryan (Gene Kelly and Frank Sinatra) moonlight as a song and dance team, much to the chagrin of more dedicated players on the team such as Goldberg (Jules Munshin). When training begins for the new season, they are surprised to learn that the new coach - K C Higgins, is keen to take a more active role in coaching. Fearing the worst, O’Brien and Ryan are pleasantly surprised to learn that the new coach is an attractive woman (Esther Williams) who knows her way around the baseball field. Friendly rivalry rears its head as the two friends both fall for the new coach, but eventually she must decide on one, and does so by choosing O’Brien. All is not lost for Ryan either, who finds himself in the arms of Shirley. O’Brien and Ryans love for vaudeville could be the undoing of the teams success however, as O’Brien is approached with a bribe by Gambler Joe Lorgan (Edward Arnold) to ditch baseball for the entertainment industry. Musical numbers staged by Stanley Donen and Gene Kelly. Cast also includes Betty Garrett, Edward Arnold and Jules Munshin.

results.title: Swoon
results.brief_description: Tom Kalin’s first feature is a stylish and challenging interpretation of the 1924 kidnapping and murder of a young boy by Chicago’s famous lovers Nathan Leopold and Richard Loeb. Although based on court transcripts and archival research, the fractured narrative and experimental format are utilized to question the mythology of the ‘pathological’ homosexual and to reorder history as it was reported.
